thread.title: Men’s Basketball: Niang, Morris on watch lists
thread.title_full: Men’s Basketball: Niang, Morris on watch lists

title: Men’s Basketball: Niang, Morris on watch lists
text:
Men’s Basketball: Niang, Morris on watch lists Men’s Basketball: Niang, Morris on watch lists By Travis Hines thines@amestrib.com 
Georges Niang and Monte Morris both landed on a preseason award watch list Monday, it was announced by the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame. 
Niang, a senior preseason All-American, is listed for the Karl Malone Ward, which is presented to the nation’s best power forward. He averaged 15.2 points per game last season while being named a finalist for the same award. 
Morris, a junior, is listed for the Bob Cousy Award, given to the nation’s best point guard. The Flint, Mich. native was a finalist for the honor last season after he averaged 11.9 points and 5.2 assists per game while sporting a 4.63 assist-to-turnover ratio, best in the country. 
The Cyclones, a likely preseason top-10 team, open the season Nov. 13 against Colorado in a game that will be played in Sioux Falls, S.D.
